Name: Banjul
Description: Banjul is the capital city of The Gambia, located on the banks of the Gambia River. It is the country s administrative and commercial center.

Name: Western Division
Description: The Western Division surrounds Banjul and is home to many of The Gambia s urban and agricultural areas.

Name: Lower River Division
Description: The Lower River Division is located along the Gambia River and is known for its farming and fishing activities.

Name: Central River Division
Description: The Central River Division is located in the center of the country and is known for its agricultural activities, particularly rice cultivation.

Name: Upper River Division
Description: The Upper River Division is located in the eastern part of the country, and its economy is based on agriculture, especially groundnuts and millet.

Name: North Bank Division
Description: The North Bank Division is located in the northern part of The Gambia, and its economy is largely based on agriculture and trade.
